description: [This Day] Huawei Digital Power sub-Saharan Africa is excited to announce the recent showcase of FusionSolar solutions at Nigeria Energy, that took place from
title: Africa: Huawei Calls for High-Quality Microgrid to Light Up a Greener Africa

description: [WHO] The World Health Organization (WHO) today published a new report on tuberculosis revealing that approximately 8.2 million people were newly diagnosed with TB in 2023 - the highest number recorded since WHO began global TB monitoring in 1995. This represents a notable increase from 7.5 million reported in 2022, placing TB again as the leading infectious disease killer in 2023, surpassing COVID-19.
title: Africa: Tuberculosis Returns as World's Deadliest Infectious Disease
Africa: Zim to Host Africa Education Summit

description: [Leadership] Seven days before the election, Trump heads to Georgia, while Harris will try to energise voters in Michigan that include an Arab American and Muslim population concerned about Israel's war on Gaza.
title: Africa: 7 Days to Go - Harris, Trump Intensify Campaigns

description: [IPS] Cali, Colombia -- As the UN's COP16 biodiversity conference continues, the temptation is to focus on the wild flora and fauna under threat.
title: Africa: Chickens As Well As Cheetahs - Biodiversity Conservation Must Also Include Livestock

description: [Nile Post] The Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (Africa CDC) is accelerating efforts to tackle viral hepatitis, a major public health threat responsible for an estimated 1.3 million deaths globally in 2022, nearly a quarter of which were in Africa.
title: Africa: Africa CDC Strengthens Efforts to Combat Viral Hepatitis in Africa, Focuses On Madagascar

description: [Africa CDC] Addis Ababa, Ethiopia -- The Africa Centres for Disease Control and Prevention (Africa CDC) in partnership with the International Society for Infectious Diseases (ISID) will host the inaugural Global Surveillance Summit, an invitational event that will bring together global leaders, innovators, and frontline workers to tackle the challenges posed by new and reemerging pandemic threats. The summit is scheduled for December 3, 2024, at the Cape Town International Convention Centre and will be held alongside the 20th International
title: Africa: Inaugural Global Surveillance Summit 2024, Cape Town, South Africa

description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- Kenyan sides Equity Hawks and Kenya Ports Authority (KPA) suffered defeats to Rwandese opposition on the second day of the Africa Zone Five Basketball Championships in Zanzibar on Monday evening.
title: Africa: Kenyan Duo Beaten By Rwandese Opposition in Africa Zone Five Champs

description: [WHO-AFRO] Addis Ababa -- World Health Organization (WHO) in the African Region and WomenLift Health today crossed a major milestone, cementing a crucial partnership to bolster investments in women's leadership in health and promote gender equity in the sector across the region.
title: Africa: WHO in Africa, WomenLift Health Sign Pivotal Agreement to Strengthen Women's Leadership in Health

description: [African Arguments] Targets for adapting to climate change are meaningless without the means to act. It's time for a clear adaptation finance goal.
title: Africa: COP29 Must Kickstart Stalled Progress On the Lifeline That Is Adaptation

description: [The Conversation Africa] Language can give people the power to take an active part in their own healthcare, or it can create barriers.
title: Africa: Cancer Care in Africa - Translations of Key Words Convey Fear and Need to Change
